Michigan Initial Health & Safety Training Module B
Section 1: Child Development

What Child Care Providers Can Do To Help Children Reach Their Fullest Potential

So, what can child care providers do to help children reach their fullest potential?

Monitor the development of the children under your care

Be familiar with the development milestones of each age. Monitor the development of the children under your care. If you feel a child is delayed in an area, discuss it with the parents. See the next slide for some tips on talking to parents.

Link parents to free resources on developmental milestones and monitoring from Act Early and Early On

Link the parents of the children in your program to free monitoring tools and fact sheets on developmental milestones. CDC’s Act Early Program and Early On/ Build UP Michigan provide excellent free resources. Links to these sites can be found in the Support Material section at the end of this section.

Encourage parents with concerns to reach out to child’s doctor and Early On/Build Up Michigan

If a delay is recognized encourage the parent to talk to the child’s doctor and make a referral to Early On/Build Up Michigan.

Work with Early Intervention Services to ensure interventions are reinforced

If the child is enrolled in Early Intervention services through Early On (0-3y.o.) or Build Up Michigan (3-5y.o.), work with therapists and early intervention services to ensure that the interventions and strategies they set up are reinforced in the child care setting.
